    Taxon profile report

    tx_report.Rd

    Run the survival, reproduction and growth analysis for the selected species

    tx_report(
  species,
  taxa,
  Animal,
  collection,
  PlotDir = NULL,
  weights = NULL,
  parents = NULL,
  move = NULL,
  contraceptions = NULL,
  DeathInformation = NULL,
  repout = list(),
  Sections = c("sur", "rep", "gro"),
  sexCats = c("Male", "Female"),
  minN = 50,
  minDate = "1980-01-01",
  Global = TRUE,
  minBirthDate = "1900-01-01",
  extractDate = NULL,
  uncert_birth = 365,
  uncert_death = 365,
  uncert_date = 365,
  minNsur = 50,
  maxNsur = NULL,
  minInstitution = 2,
  minlx = 0.1,
  MinBirthKnown = 0.3,
  maxOutl = 100,
  XMAX = 120,
  Min_MLE = 0.1,
  MaxLE = 2,
  firstyear = FALSE,
  models_sur = "GO",
  shape = "bathtub",
  niter = 25000,
  burnin = 5001,
  thinning = 20,
  nchain = 3,
  ncpus = 2,
  minAge = 0,
  lastdead = FALSE,
  Repsect = c("agemat", "litter"),
  Birth_Type = "Captive",
  parentProb_Dam = 80,
  parentProb_Sire = 80,
  minNlitter = 20,
  Nday = 7,
  minNrepro = 100,
  minNparepro = 30,
  minNseas = 50,
  minNgro = 100,
  minNIgro = 50,
  MeasureType = "Live weight",
  models_gro = "vonBertalanffy"
)

    Arguments

    species

    character the name of the species studied

    taxa

    character the name of the taxa studied

    Animal

    data.frame core data

    collection

    data.frame collection data

    PlotDir

    character Directory to save the plots. Default = NULL, no plot is saved

    weights

    data.frame weights data if the growth analysis is run

    parents

    data.frame parents data if the reproduction analysis is run

    move

    data frame Moves data including at least the following columns: AnimalAnonID, To, Date

    contraceptions

    data.frame contraception data if the reproduction analysis is run

    DeathInformation

    data.frame including at least the following columns AnimalAnonID and RelevantDeathInformationType

    repout

    list Previous result of the taxon profile for this species if it needs to be updated only

    Sections

    vector of character names of the sections to update in the taxon profile results: "sur", "rep" and/or "gro". Default = c("sur", "rep", "gro")

    sexCats

    character Male, Female or All Default = "All"

    minN

    numeric Minimum number of individuals. Default = 50

    minDate

    character 'YYYY-MM-DD' Earlier date to include data

    Global

    logical Whether only individuals belonging to global collections should be used.

    minBirthDate

    character: Earlier possible date: date used when minimum birth or death date unknown

    extractDate

    character 'YYYY-MM-DD' Date of data extraction

    uncert_birth

    numeric: Maximum uncertainty accepted for birth dates, in days

    uncert_death

    numeric: Maximum uncertainty accepted for death dates, in days. Default = 365

    uncert_date

    numeric: Maximum uncertainty accepted for measurement dates: weight, in days. Default = 365

    minNsur

    numeric Minimum number of individual records needed to run the survival analysis. Default = 50

    maxNsur

    numeric Maximum number of individual records to run the survival analysis. Default = NULL

    minInstitution

    numeric Minimum number of institutions that should hold records to run the analyses. Default = 2

    minlx

    numeric between 0 and 1. Minimum reached survivorship from the raw Kaplan Meier analysis needed to run the survival analysis. Default = 0.1

    MinBirthKnown

    numeric between 0 and 1. Minimum proportion of individuals with a known birth month in the data. Default = 0.3

    maxOutl

    numeric Maximum threshold for the longevity distribution. Default = 100

    XMAX

    numeric Maximum possible age. Default = 120

    Min_MLE

    numeric Goodness of fit: Minimum survivorship at Mean life expectancy

    MaxLE

    numeric Goodness of fit: Maximum remaining life expectancy at max age

    firstyear

    logical Whether to do the analysis only on first year. Default = FALSE

    models_sur

    vector of characters names of the survival basta models to run: "G0", "EX", "LO" and/or "WE". see ?basta for more information. Default = "GO"

    shape

    character shape of the survival basta model to run: "simple", "Makeham", "bathtub". see ?basta for more information. Default = "simple"

    niter

    numeric. number of MCMC iterations to run the survival model. see ?basta for more information. Default = 25000

    burnin

    numeric Number of iterations removed so that the survival model has time to converge. see ?basta for more information. Default = 5001

    thinning

    numeric Number of iteration to run the survival model before saving a set of parameters. see ?basta for more information. Default = 20

    nchain

    numeric Number of chains to run the survival model. Default = 5001

    ncpus

    numeric Number of computer core to use. Default = 2

    minAge

    numeric Ages at which the analyses should start. see ?basta for more information. Default = 0

    lastdead

    logical Whether the longest lived individuals should be considered dead. Default = FALSE

    Repsect

    character names of the reproductive analyses to run: "agemat", "litter" and/or ...

    Birth_Type

    character Captive, Wild, or All. Default = "Captive"

    parentProb_Dam

    numeric Minimum percentage of parentage probability to include for Dam. Default = 80

    parentProb_Sire

    numeric Minimum percentage of parentage probability to include for Sire. Default = 80

    minNlitter

    numeric Minimum number of litters to run the analysis. The data frame for litter size will be produced in all cases. Default = 30

    Nday

    numeric Number of consecutive days over which the birth dates of a litter/clutch can be spread. Default = 7

    minNrepro

    numeric Minimum number of birth records needed to run reproductive analyses. Default = 50

    minNparepro

    numeric Minimum number of unique parent records needed to run reproductive analyses. Default = 30

    minNseas

    numeric XXXXXXXXXXX

    minNgro

    numeric Minimum number of weight needed to fit the growth models

    minNIgro

    numeric Minimum number of unique individuals needed to fit the growth models

    MeasureType

    vector of characters Name of the type of measurements that should be included. Default = NULL, all measurement type are included.

    models_gro

    vector of characters indicating the growth models that need to be fit.The following models are supported : logistic, gompertz, chapmanRichards, vonBertalanffy, polynomial. default = "vonBertalanffy"

    Value

    a list including the results and summary of each analysis

    Examples

    file = system.file("sci_Animal.csv", package = 'ISRverse')
ZIMSdirtest = dirname(file)
data <- Load_Zimsdata  (taxa = "Reptilia",
                       species = list(Reptilia = "All"),
                       ZIMSdir = ZIMSdirtest,
                       Animal = TRUE, tables = c("Collection","DeathInformation"))
#> ReptiliaLoading Collection of Reptilia.Loading DeathInformation of Reptilia.Reptilia Done.

Animal<- Prep_Animal(data[["Reptilia"]]$Animal, extractDate="2024/08/29"  )
PlotDir = paste0(tempdir(check = TRUE),'\\temp')
dir.create(PlotDir)

out <- tx_report(species = "Testudo hermanni", taxa = "Reptilia",
                 Animal, data$Reptilia$Collection, 
                 Birth_Type = "All", uncert_birth = 3500,uncert_death = 3500, 
                 DeathInformation =data$Reptilia$DeathInformation,
                 PlotDir = PlotDir,Sections = c('sur'),
                 sexCats = c("Male", "Female"),
                 models_sur = "GO", shape = "simple",
                 models_gro = "vonBertalanffy",
                 niter = 1000, burnin = 101, thinning = 10, nchain = 3, ncpus = 3
)
#>  ****************************  Male  ****************************
#> Survival Running ------------------------------------------------
#>  ****************************  Female  ****************************
#> Survival Running ------------------------------------------------

list.files(PlotDir)
#> [1] "Long_dist" "Survival" 
unlink(PlotDir, recursive = TRUE)
